title: Resnet Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really quick and straightforward, it couldn't have been easier. I was asked by the interviewer about certain diagnosis scenarios and how I would resolve their issues.
Interview Questions: A resident cannot connect their laptop to a front desk printer. How would you diagnose this issue?

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really well, I was told other turned it down because they wanted a pay outside the range provided. I wanted within range. I was told HR would contact me the next week about background and reference check. After not hearing anything for 3 weeks I followed up, and was told they were still searching to full the position.
Interview Questions: It was usual interview questions.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: You can get more information from the career center. You can apply through the school website.  - You will get an email quickly if you are selected. Super easy process.
Interview Questions: Why apply for this position?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very professional. There were two people who sat in on the interview and asked questions. They made it really easy to talk to them, definitely took the edge off.
Interview Questions: What work experience do you have in healthcare?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: Attend a information session, apply online (fill out several questions about personal experience with diversity  and related questions, make a mock welcome letter), attend a personal interview and a group process day.
Interview Questions: How do you handle large deadlines and or changing responsibilities?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Good, no complaint. The process went smoothly, no deviated from the purpose or objective of recruiting the right person. Interview on Zoom is a lots better than in-person especially during COVID time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Tell me about your experience in teaching.

title: Student Building Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty simple- you set up a time with the professional staff and you will hear back within a few days. You will also do some shadow shifts.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I was called in to speak with the Department Head. They asked pretty standard questions. "How do you handle people getting rude with you?" "How do you manage being busy with tasks? What do you do first?" "What do you do if you don't know what to do next?" Then a few days later HR called me to offer me the position contingent on passing a background check and drug screening. That was it!
Interview Questions: "How do you handle people getting rude with you?"

title: Student Recycling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Great. Made comfortable by the staff. Interview was not stressful. There was 3 people interviewing me and their feedback made the conversation smoother. It was a great experience and test of caractère because you don’t expect 3 people for an interview generally.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for the position.?

title: Desk Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an assistant hall director to conduct a phone screening and quick over the phone interview.  After they had finished the interviewing process, I was contacted with a job offer, and began training right before classes started.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was seamless and they were very professional. The interviewer asked typical questions and nothing was out of the ordinary. They were very polite and I got along with the interviewer very well. I cannot say enough good things about this university.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Long and drawn out, phone interview, then in person. There is a committee that handles the hiring process. You'll always start with a phone interview and then come in for an in-person interview. You can't negotiate salary.
Interview Questions: What is your advising philosophy?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: They asked my about my background and why I am the best for this position. also they asked me about my goals and how this position can help me achieve the goals.
Interview Questions: What skilled do you have that fit for the position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: I guess, luckily, this part or the interview process was pretty pain free because I was not interviewed. I only went the the application process. However, I had taken classes with some of the professors before applying.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy, asked to give a presentation on any topic . Professors are good and helpful. They make your schedule in such a way that it will always a balance with study
Interview Questions: What all software do you know in GIS?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Be warned.   The hiring process is very long, sometimes up to 3 months for a professional staff position.  Most positions require a hiring committee so the committee must first review all the applicants.  You have to match your skills with the job description and you must have all the requirements to even get an interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Application, first round interview. It can take a long time for them to get back to you on initial interviews, but after that the process goes faster. It is difficult to find open positions unless you already attend school there.
Interview Questions: Basic questions related to strengths, weaknesses, etc

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Each department hiring will do the interview. You are required to send in a resume and application. They just asked about my experience and how I would fit in the role. It was a fairly normal interview. It lasted 30 minutes or so.
Interview Questions: Asked about previous work experience

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview before invited to campus for an in-person interview. Interview included a written test of customer service questions and sql. Interview was conducted by four-person team from the department.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you have worked with a frustrated/angry customer and how you resolved the situation. 
Describe experience managing a database. 
How do you deal with stress?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: A few fairly straight forward questions to test your time management and ethical skills. There was a group of interviewers that all worked at the same department I wanted to work for.  No tricky questions were asked during the interview.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a situation where you the GA and a professor you are working with did not get along?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was not difficult. if you are qualified, you are qualified. The head of department will look into applicator's information from the school. He knows how's applicator's performance at school.  Therefore, when you get an interview, you probably already get this position.
Interview Questions: welcome to the board

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Sprin, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a conversation with Administrative Assistant II at the Front Desk.  First we talked on the phone and then I received a call back for an in person interview. I meet with Administrative Assistant and answered a few questions we visited then I waited for the Department Head she had a few questions for me. Then all three of us just visited with each other for awhile. The total time for the in person interview was an hour and fifteen minutes and much of that was just visiting with one another.
Interview Questions: What office experience did you have?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Went to Graduate Recruitment Weekend and interviewed with 5 different supervisors. The questions were pretty basic, but also each supervisor has questions specific to their department, but they were mostly, tell us about yourself, why are you choosing to come to MSU and work as a graduate assistant, ect. 
This process is unique because you rank the assistantships you want in order and the supervisors all get together and rank you. They try to match you with the supervisor who wanted you most in relation to the assistantship you want most. I chose the Admissions office and they chose me. I received an offer about 2 weeks after the weekend.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges facing students and parents of students sending their children to college?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was studying already and as international student I had the chance to work on campus. As a reuslt, I had the opportunity to work no more than  20 hours per week, which was helpful for my expenses in the United States.
Interview Questions: What are you currently studying?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was a quick discussion with the director. The focus was mainly on whether I had the requisite qualifications to tutor math, which I did. Very informal, offer made immediately.
Interview Questions: What math courses have you passed?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Missouri State University in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Actually I have applied for MS admission. After that, I have got admission and the department had contacted with me for an interview with professor via skype so that they can judge me about my ability. After that, we had a meeting via skype. It goes well with very friendly discussion about my ambition for research. After few days, I have got the offer letter.
Interview Questions: What is your future target?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: It was very conversational. The department head just wanted to learn more about me and described what I would be doing. One of the easiest interviews I've had. However, your experience may vary depending on the department.
Interview Questions: Greatest strengths and weaknesses, tell me about yourself...

title: ESL Conseling Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewer interviewed me face to face, told me more information about the position and asked me related questions.
Than she asked me to wait for the manager. But the manager was busy at that time, so she let me leave first and told me she would imform me the interviewing answer in the end of this week.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have before?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty laid back interview. I already had someone email the person to give a recommendation and I got hired on the spot. Great experience and flexible schedule.
Interview Questions: What made you want to apply for this position?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: 1. phone interview first with 4 people; asked a few basic screening questions 2. 2-day campus interview with vice president, dean and faculty members/graduate students; very friendly school (with welcome basket in the hotel room and everything); a large campus;
Interview Questions: why you apply; what classes you can teach; your research plan

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: I began working for the Missouri State Bookstore as a temporary position, they where looking for short term text reservation help therefore had very standard process with typical strength/ weakness questions. I was taking into a conference room at the Bookstore and interviewed. Once accepted with a call there was a training orientation before beginning. After the Text Reservation process I was grandfathered into a part-time position because of my ability to work hard.
Interview Questions: What takes up most of your time/abilities?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: Very formal, asked a bunch of behavioral questions. I just went through my prior experience and career goals.  After a couple of days they got back to me with an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Self Recommendations
Interview Questions: Most questions are related to the grade or experience receive from a subject.

title: Web Works Student Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email off, replying to one of the mass emails which go out occasionally. I had one interview and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was slow, taking about two months to complete.  It began with a phone interview, then an in-person interview, both with a hiring committee.  The questions were canned and expected.  The in-person interview also included a short "quiz" with technical questions on it regarding programming basics and SQL queries.
Interview Questions:
What was an instance where you didn't get along with a coworker and how was it handled?
What's the difference between an analyst and a programmer?
What is the difference between an inner SQL join and an outer SQL join?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Missouri State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was rather easy as I needed to talk with the graduate director of the comms department.  Very friendly and easy to do.
Interview Questions: Again, interview process was easy and just needed to touch on my educational background and future goals.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Missouri State University in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The process was very pleasant and the phone interview lasted for approximately an hour. The interviewer was interested in a lively discussion about the job responsibilities and how the interviewee fit in. We spent time on discussing my previous experiences and how that would be useful for this position. We also discussed about the expectations in this position and future job prospects.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experiences?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard hiring process: filling out application form, got contacted by the office specialist, scheduling interview, preparing for interview, waiting for the result for about a week, and was informed that I had been hired.
Interview Questions: Nothing special.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Application, then full day event with all the other applicants. The day is spent testing teamwork skills, decision making process through scenarios and priority lists. After words is the job interview itself. All three events are used to determine employment.
Interview Questions: What are some ways you would like to get your residents involved on campus?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Recruitment Weekend Interview Day: students were asked to apply for as many positions as they desired and then the employer selected the desired candidates.  Selected candidates were asked to interview during the recruitment weekend interview day.  Interviews lasted 30 minutes with 20 minutes of interviews and 10 minutes of questions.  The interview process was formal and allowed for an hour break for students to have lunch with all the professional staff interviewing candidates. It was a pleasant interview day.
Interview Questions:
Discuss experience working with students
Discuss involvement in campus activities
Discuss leadership experience 
Discuss strengths and weaknesses

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: After applying on line you will wait  anywhere from 2 weeks to 3 months to be called in for an interview.  4-5 candidates will be interviewed and they will select the one that is desperate enough to accept their salary, health benefit and retirement package.  Once hired you will be assigned an office and will have to spend a couple of days filling out a lot of paperwork for HR,  watching videos about sexual harassment, covering the employee handbook and getting a crash course in their health insurance plan (which you won't remember by the time you need to use it anyway).
Interview Questions: Just the standard customary interview questions.  "Why would you be good for this job?"  "Have you every participated in any kind of team event?"  "Give an example of adversity and how you overcame it?"  Bla, bla bla......

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Apply online. Quick interview with other office workers. Received phone call with in a couple days.
interview was easy. Simply stated what the office does after going over resume. No brainbuster questions.
Interview Questions: Do you know what this office does?

title: Assistant Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Coaching is who you know.   Got a call and was asked to interview.  After my interview I was asked to submit a resume online.  Their online app was about average in length.  Got offered the job the day after. Accepted and stayed for a couple years before moving on to a better position.
Interview Questions: What do you like so far about Missouri State?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very structured. The application process had multiple requirements verifications right from the beginning (e.g., include transcript). The process continued with a phone interview followed by a group interview (5-6 search committee members). The questions were pre-planned (typed) for uniformity in the selection process. The process took a long time but it is all part of their structure.
Interview Questions: The interview opened with the generic question of "Describe yourself and why you feel you are a right fit for this position."

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The director of the department conducted the interview. The interview was casual, not intimidating.  She provided relevant information about the department and the position in addition to the interview questions. Further, she answered all the questions I had about the position.
Interview Questions: What do you do when faced with a problem you don't understand?

title: Assistant Professor, Media and Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and straightforward.  However, MSU is practicing reverse discrimination by actively seeking out minorities even if they are less qualified.  It's becoming a little too politically correct for a Midwest Ozarks employer.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous job experience.

title: Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Missouri State University (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was long and drawn out.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with advertising terminology?
